title: Yosemite Medical Clinic - Yosemite National Park (U.S. National Park Service)
sitename: Yosemite National Park (U.S. National Park Service)
cleaned_text: Caring for our community by providing quality care, improving access to medical services, and promoting healthy lifestyles. Managed and operated by the National Park Service (NPS), the clinic is staffed by [U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps](https://usphs.gov) (USPHS) and NPS healthcare providers. We offer basic medical care for both residents and visitors. Learn more about our [current staff](/yose/planyourvisit/ymcstaff.htm). Hours Open year-round, closed on federal holidays. - Hours: Monday-Friday, 9 am to 5 pm; closed from noon to 1 pm. (Walk-ins accepted Monday-Thursday between 1 pm and 3:30 pm unless clinic capacity is reached earlier.) - Getting Here: Located in Yosemite Valley near the Village Store, between Yosemite Village and The Ahwahnee. - Accessibility: This facility is accessible. Designated accessible parking spaces are located behind the building. Closed on the following days: 2023 Holidays Services | | Holiday | | Date | | New Year's Day | | Observed Monday, January 2, 2023 | | Birthday of Martin Luther King, Jr. | | Monday, January 16, 2023 | | Washington's Birthday | | Monday, February 20, 2023 | | Memorial Day | | Monday, May 29, 2023 | | Juneteenth National Independence Day | | Monday, June 19, 2023 | | Independence Day | | Tuesday, July 4, 2023 | | Labor Day | | Monday, September 4, 2023 | | Columbus Day | | Monday, October 9, 2023 | | Veterans Day | | Observed Friday, November 10, 2023 | | Thanksgiving Day | | Thursday, November 23, 2023 | | Christmas Day | | Monday, December 25, 2023 Primary Care (for all age groups) - Accepting new patients - Physical and wellness exams for all age groups - Sports physicals - Chronic disease management - Mental health screening and care coordination - Substance Use Disorders treatment and recovery referral - Annual health maintenance - Care coordination and case management Preventative Services - Immunizations and other preventative services including COVID-19 vaccines - Sexual Transmitted Infection (STI) screening and treatment - HIV/AIDS post-exposure and pre- exposure prophylaxis - Age based recommended cancer screenings Complementary and alternative medicine Urgent Care (Out of Pocket) - Non-life threatening illness evaluation and treatment (i.e., colds, flu, and infections) - Minor injury care (i.e., fractures, sprains, strains, cuts, abrasions) Employee Health Diagnostic services Insurance Accepted (Verification Required) Primary Care - Anthem Medi-Cal for Mariposa County - Blue Cross Blue Shield Federal employees - BCBS Unite Here Health - Blue Shield of CA (PPO all commercial plans) - Tricare West/Prime Remote - Medi-Cal (California state and Mariposa County plans) - Medicare Urgent Care (Out of Pocket) - Local plans accepted but some may require prior approval. - United Health Care - Out of state or international will be self-pay Payment Options Credit card, Paypal, Amazon, personal check, pay.gov or money order (available at the post office). Individuals who self-pay can be provided with documentation to seek reimbursement from third party payers The clinic can also offer information about applying for Medi-Cal. Contact Information For Appointment and Billing Questions Mailing Address PO Box 550 Yosemite National Park, CA 95389 Physical Address 9000 Ahwahnee Drive Yosemite National Park, CA 95389 Located between Yosemite Village and The Ahwahnee Emergency Medical Services (Ambulance Services) - If you have a medical emergency, text or call 911 (24/7) Notice of Privacy Practices Please read our
